humanum_full_description_en:
" Crystal " is the first text of " Star ", and the original meaning of " Crystal " is displayed as the name of astrology from " Crystal ". Xiaozhuan province from the " Day ", "said the text": "Pleiades, White Tiger Su stars from Japan, Mao sound.." The literature handed down more than a Pleiades records, such as "Ya. "Shi Tian": "Daliang, Pleiades. Xilu, Pleiades." Guo Pu's note: "The hotel in the West is called Yangtou." "Book. "Yao Dian": "The short star Pleiades in the day, the mid-winter." The biography of Kong Anguo: "The Pleiades, the star of the white tiger." "Lv's Spring and Autumn. Beginning": "The West says Haotian, its star stomach, Pleiades, and Bi."

Pleiades is called Pleiades nebula (M45) in astronomy today. It is the brightest star cluster in the sky that can be observed with the naked eye. A unique form, the Pleiades star cluster is also known as the Seven Sisters cluster, and in ancient China it was called the "White Maotou". "Historical Records. "Tian Guan Shu": "Pleiades said that the head of the hair, Hu Xing also, is the white clothing meeting." According to the Pleiades, the stars linger like a cloud of smoke, so it is called the "white clothing meeting." Such as Zhang Shoujie justice: "The Pleiades are the fashion stars, and the Hu stars are also the prison affairs." That is, the Pleiades are the symbol of the prison affairs.

Bronze script is used as a place name, 敔𣪕: "Nei (in) cut [氵𡧮], Zhuo, Shenquan, Yumin, Yinyangluo", which means attacking Zhuo and other places.

"卯" in the Qin bamboo slips is pronounced " Pleiades ", referring to the Pleiades. "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese book B. "March" Jane 85: "Mao (Pleiades), sloppy (hunting), Jia Shiji." The whole sentence refers to the Pleiades, hunting and trading are all auspicious.

The cover of the lacquer box unearthed from the tomb of Hou Yi of Zeng bears the name of the twenty-eight places in Zhushu, that is, " Mao " Tongjia is " Pleiades ".
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The inscriptions from " Jing ", " Mao " sound, the original meaning is the fourth lodging of the seven lodgings of the white tiger in the sky and the west, commonly known as "sweeping head".
humanum_full_description:
「晶」是「星」的初文，金文從「晶」以顯示本義為星宿名。小篆省從「日」，《說文》：「昴，白虎宿星。从日，卯聲。」傳世文獻多有昴星的記載，如《爾雅．釋天》：「大梁，昴也。西陸，昴也。」郭璞注：「西方之宿，名叫旄頭。」《書．堯典》：「日短星昴，以正仲冬。」孔安國傳：「昴，白虎之中星。」《呂氏春秋．有始》：「西方曰顥天，其星胃、昴、畢。」

　　昴宿今日天文學上稱作昴星團 (Pleiades nebula, M45), 是天上能以肉眼觀測到的最亮的星團，由七顆極為密集的中度亮星和無數光度微弱的小星組成，由於這一獨特形態，昴星團又被稱為七姊妹星團，而中國古代稱之為「白毛頭」，亦以此故。《史記．天官書》：「昴曰髦頭，胡星也，為白衣會。」按昴星星氣如雲煙縈迴，故稱「白衣會」，後世星象家附會為凶兆。如張守節正義：「昴七星為髦星，胡星，亦為獄事」，即以昴星為刑獄之事的象徵。

　　金文用作地名，敔𣪕：「內(入)伐[氵𡧮]、昴、參泉、裕敏、陰陽洛」，表示攻打昴等地。

　　秦簡中「卯」讀為「昴」，指昴星。《睡虎地秦簡．日書乙種．三月》簡85：「卯(昴)，邋(獵)、賈市吉。」全句指有昴星，打獵、買賣都是吉利的。

　　曾侯乙墓出土漆盒蓋上有朱書二十八宿之名，即以「茅」通假為「昴」。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「晶」，「卯」聲，本義是天上二十八宿中西方白虎七宿的第四宿，俗稱「旄頭」。

昴字的基本解释

昴
mǎo
星名，二十八宿之一。

昴字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mǎo］
［《廣韻》莫飽切，上巧，明。］
星宿名。二十八宿之一。

昴字的康熙字典解释

【辰集上】【日字部】　昴； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页494第06
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?莫飽切，音卯。【說文】作?，白虎宿星。【爾雅·釋天】大梁，昴也。西陸，昴也。【註】昴，西方之宿。別名旄頭。【書·堯典】日短星昴。【傳】昴，白虎之中星。　又【集韻】謨交切，音茅。義同。　又【韻補】叶力求切。【詩·召南】嘒彼小星，維參與昴。叶下裯、猶。【疏】《元命苞》云：昴六星，昴之爲言留也，言物成就繫留是也。又?。
